Package com.cafean.JobStatus.OutputViewer

Class BlockFileAccessClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.JobStatus.OutputViewer.BlockFileAccessClient
  • public class BlockFileAccessClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The BlockFileAccessClient is used as part of a system to remotely view possibly very large text files over a possibly very limited network connection. It is used, in this instance, to view output files from calculations managed by com.cafean.CalcServer; The BFAC also provides access to particular indexed line numbers referred to as Points of Interest. Definition of special indexes occurs in BlockFileAccessManager; the BFAC caches a hashtable of LineBlocks(100 line sections) as lines are are requested from the OutputViewer; the size of the cache is can be set with setCacheSize and defaults to 200; these blocks are loaded from the BlockFileAccessManager through CalcServerIntf; Note: Destroy MUST be called when BFAC is no longer needed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockFileAccessClient

        public BlockFileAccessClient​(CalcServerRequester requester,
                             int run_dbid,
                             java.lang.String path,
                             ViewableFile file,
                             FileType type,
                             int lineCount)
        Creates a new BFAC, initializing it with the open output file associated with the given run.
        Parameters:
        requester - the CalcServerRequestor to use when communicating with the calculation server.
        run_dbid - the calculation ID of the run to retrieve output blocks from
        path - the Path to the file
        file - the ViewableFile to view remotely
        type - the FileType of the target file.
        lineCount - the number of lines in run_dbid's output file

      • isPoiAvailable

        public boolean isPoiAvailable()
        returns true if points of interest are defined for the file handled by this client.

      • getPOICount

        public int getPOICount()

      • getPOINames

        public java.lang.String[] getPOINames()

      • setCacheSize

        public int setCacheSize​(int size)
        Sets the number of blocks to cache. when the cache hits this number it begins removing old entries as new ones are added; if size is less than the number of cached blocks, blocks will be pruned down to size the default is 200 blocks of 100 lines.
        Parameters:
        size - the new number of blocks to cache
        Returns:
        the number of blocks purged

      • getCacheSize

        public int getCacheSize()
        gets the current cache size
        Returns:
        int the number of LineBlocks the BFAC will cache;

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        frees all resources associated with this BFAC

      • getLineCount

        public long getLineCount()
        gets the length of the currently open file in lines.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the number of lines indexed in the currently open output file

        Parameters:

        Returns:
